title: (x) Grant Her Wishes - Relay Wide {Tiff}
content:
I don't have much time to hunt for this one today, and frankly it's got me stumped. Anyone?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015200914im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/21236.gif)   
   
Thanks in advance.   
   
{ btw, the

 [‹ (x) chunky slab "November 2003" - Clarendon {BJ, Karl}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015200914/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2302 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) VM Frakt - Bookman (squished) {Eduardo} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015200914/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2300 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Grant Hutchinson

comments.content: That face looks familiar -- is that from Men's Health?
Something Font Bureau or Something Hoefler.

Wait wait wait: isn't that Cyrus Highsmith's work?   
The Fontbureau Inc. Website is all buggy, so I can't   
check right now.

Font Bureau's Relay, by Cyrus Highsmith. Wow! To be in the presence of such brilliance, I'm truly honored.   
   
;)
[Relay Black Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015200914/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?cart=106756109210270117&fontname=Relay), but that **G** has been altered.

Brilliant or not, it's YOU who nailed the little bugger.   
It is with great pleasure that I grant you the credit for   
this ID.

Someone from Men's Health finally got back to me, essentially confirming Tiff's ID, though the contact said it was MHM Relay Wide Black, a custom face made just for the magazine, which would explain any aberrances. I don't know what that MHM stands for.
Just figured out the MHM. Men's Health Magazine. Duh...
Further response from Men's Health confirms that, indeed, Cyrus Highsmith did it.

\>\> Relay Black Wide, but that G has been altered.   
   
I

i am a happy owner of the Relay Wide and i checked.. there is not an alternative G   
   
i reckon they put a hyphen or a string on top of the G just to make it look groovie.. any way i like the Relay G:s as they are.. and if i wanted my G Granted like the "Grant Her Wish" i would have used Interstate instead.

I'm thinking that Mr. Roger Black, or his company [DaniloBlack](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015200914/http:/www.daniloblack.com/), was involved with the redesign and thus the reason they have their own tasty versions of certain letters.

_\> i reckon they put a hyphen or a string on top of the G just   
to make it look groovie_      
   
_\> the contact said it was MHM Relay Wide Black, a custom   
face made just for the magazine, which would explain any   
aberrances._

ooooooooopsssssszzzz... i did it again..   
   
i missunderstood the E.Gordon's post about an alternative G. Now i see he meant Highsmiths version of the Relay.   
   
double duh!   
sorry Yves
